item.description:
If interested in the following, please put yourself on the established waiting list. A yes list will be provided as soon as possible.

Criteria: All hikers must be able to maintain a minimum pace of two miles an hour for a minimum of two hours. All hikers must have cold weather gear and be experienced above treeline in winter conditions.

All attendees must read, understand and agree to the waiver/liability as outlined by this website.
starting at Mount Kearsarge North Trailhead

This trail ascends Kearsarge North from a small parking area on the north side of Hurricane Mountain Rd., 1.5 mi. east of NH 16 near the state highway rest area at Intervale.

Back to here hike 3.10 mi/2 hr 52 min/+2587 ft on the Mount Kearsarge North Trail
Leaving the road, the trail runs level for a short distance, then climbs rather easily past a summer residence on an old road well up on the bank above a brook. It passes several boulders, and the old road starts to become rougher. It climbs steadily into a ledgy area, where there are views to Mt. Chocorua and Moat Mountain, crosses the crest of the ridge connecting Kearsarge North to Bartlett Mountain, then swings right and ascends mostly along the north side of the ridge. The trail makes a sharp right turn at a steep spot, then angles upward, circling to the left around to the west edge of the summit ledges, and climbs to the tower.
to Kearsarge North

Totals
Distance 3.10 mi
Time 2 hr 52 min
Elev Gain +2630 ft
Elev Loss -43 ft
Elev Change +2587 ft

Driving Directions
Show in Google Earth
Download to GPS

Back to here hike 3.10 mi/2 hr 52 min/-2587 ft on the Mount Kearsarge North Trail
The Mount Kearsarge North Trail descends from the summit fire tower. It circles around to the west ledges then descends the ledges. It then swings to the north side of the ridge and crosses the crest of the ridge connecting Kearsarge North to Bartlett Mountain. It enters another open ledgy area where there are views to Mt. Chocorua and Moat Mountain. It descends steadily down the mountain. It passes several boulders then joins an old road and the grade eases. It passes a summer residence and descends easily to the road.
to Mount Kearsarge North Trailhead

Totals
Distance 6.20 mi
Time 5 hr 44 min
Elev Gain +2673 ft
Elev Loss -2673 ft
Elev Change 0 ft

Driving Directions
Show in Google Earth
Download to GPS
item.how_to_find_us: WE WILL BE IN A FOUR DOOR SUBARU LEGACY
item.name: KEARSARGE NORTH
